title.rendered: The Importance Of Respectful Workplace Training: Why Your Business Needs It

content.rendered:
[vc_row row_height_percent=”0″ overlay_alpha=”50″ gutter_size=”3″ shift_y=”0″][vc_column column_width_percent=”80″ overlay_alpha=”50″ gutter_size=”3″ medium_width=”0″ shift_x=”0″ shift_y=”0″ z_index=”0″ width=”1/1″ css=”.vc_custom_1486487468849{padding-right: 50px !important;padding-left: 50px !important;}”][vc_empty_space empty_h=”2″][vc_column_text]We live in a world where employees call, text, email, slack, and ping more than they meet face-to-face, so it’s important you and your talent learn how to communicate effectively. In other words, in order for your business to succeed, you must learn the importance of developing and deploying a respectful workplace training.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space empty_h=”1″][vc_custom_heading heading_semantic=”div” text_size=”h3″ text_height=”fontheight-357766″ text_font=”font-148806″ text_color=”color-prif” css_animation=”alpha-anim” animation_speed=”500″ animation_delay=”100″]

The Impact of No Respectful Workplace Training

[/vc_custom_heading][vc_column_text]Not sure how training your employees on respecting themselves, each other, and customers could yield anything more than a few kudos from the PR world? Well, if you pass on introducing your teams to respectful workplace training you’ll miss out on retaining more of your in-demand talent for longer, which will then make it challenging for you to market to specific demographics successfully.

Respect in the workplace is connected to more than just your company’s image. According to Harvard Business Review, incivility will cost your enterprise its productivity considering their recent survey revealed that almost 50 percent of employees reported deliberately reducing their work efforts once they felt disrespected or violated in the workplace.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space empty_h=”0″][vc_custom_heading heading_semantic=”div” text_size=”h3″ text_height=”fontheight-357766″ text_font=”font-148806″ text_color=”color-prif” css_animation=”alpha-anim” animation_speed=”500″ animation_delay=”100″]

Steps to Effective & Respectful Workplace Training

[/vc_custom_heading][vc_column_text]In today’s fast-paced world, your business needs to stand out from the competition to attract and retain in-demand talent, but if this talent doesn’t feel respect or appreciation they won’t stick around for long.

Your company will need to develop a respectful workplace training if you’re looking to keep your tech, IT, and digital marketing teams from becoming disengaged, disrespected, and unmotivated. Check out how these tips can help your business create an effective training program:[/vc_column_text][uncode_list icon=”fa fa-mail-reply”]

  • Rethink Respect.  Before you can even think about creating a successful respectful workplace training, you and your team leads must understand that respect in the workplace in not finite. As Steven Bladder from Academy of Management put it, “it can be given to one employee without shortchanging others.” Before ideating your new training program it’s crucial that everyone involved has a shared definition of respect; you and your employees must think of respect as an endless resource. 
  • Acknowledge Interdepence. When talking about a respectful workplace we have to go back to the saying we’ve all heard before in some form or fashion: respect can only be earned, never commanded or forced. You will also need to acknowledge that everyone’s roles are connected. Employees will need leadership and your leaders will need the workforce; acknowledging these interdependent relationships and that everyone is a part of a bigger whole will help instill confidence and trust in your talent, helping them feel respected at work and ready to reciprocate. 
  • Choose a CDO. Not sure what a Chief Diversity Officer(CDO) is or why this role would be crucial in implementing a respectful workplace training? CDOs are the professionals tasked with overseeing company-wide diversity training to curate a work culture where all employees can be productive, respected, and feel safe in their work environments. CDOs will be the ones with the experience and knowledge to know the exact type of training will be the most beneficial for your business, employees, and bottom line.

[/uncode_list][vc_empty_space empty_h=”0″][vc_column_text]Once you hire a CDO to ensure you’re creating an inclusive culture, acknowledge the importance of every employees’ position, and rethink the way you think about respect, you’ll be ready to start drafting your respectful workplace training. If you need the executive IT and digital marketing leaders who can help implement respectful workplace training successfully,  contact Mondo, today. Our recruiters can connect you with professionals who have experience working with diverse teams and implementing respect from the top down.[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space empty_h=”3″][/vc_column][/vc_row]
